t: Why*pn do the nations rage and*ln the peoples plot in vain?
The*ln kings of the earth take their stand, and*ln the rulers conspire together against*ln the Lord*s and his Anointed One:
“Let’s*ln tear off their chains and*ln throw their ropes off of us.”
The*pn one enthroned in heaven laughs; the*ln Lord ridicules them.
Then*ln he speaks to them in his anger and*ln terrifies them in his wrath:
“I*ln have installed my king on*ln Zion, my holy mountain.”
I*pn will declare the Lord’s*s decree. He*ln said to me, “You are my Son; today*ln I have become your Father.
Ask*ln of me, and*ln I will make the nations your inheritance and*ln the ends of the earth your possession.
You*ln will break them with an iron scepter; you*ln will shatter them like pottery.”
So*pn now, kings, be wise; receive*ln instruction, you judges of the earth.
Serve*ln the Lord*s with reverential awe and*ln rejoice with trembling.
Pay*ln homage to the Son or he will be angry and*ln you will perish in your rebellion, for*ln his anger may ignite at any moment. All*ln who take refuge in him are happy.
